info.game_comments:
1997-A Teen Tournament quarterfinal game 4.
Infestation of the tribbles.

(1, 1).clue: Magnetism occurs most strongly in 3 elements: nickel, cobalt & this

(2, 1).clue: The American branch of this group gives the Charles Drew Award for contribution to blood services

(3, 1).clue: The African rain forests are the natural habitat of these largest apes

(4, 1).clue: David Marcus, son of this captain on the original "Star Trek", was killed on the Genesis planet

(5, 1).clue: This Norse god had iron gloves, a belt of strength & a magic hammer

(6, 1).clue: This sacred river flows through Bangladesh before emptying into the Bay of Bengal

(1, 2).clue: In 1665 Robert Hooke described & named this structural unit; bacteria have only one

(2, 2).clue: The year's best praise & worship album is recognized by the association for this type of vocal music

(3, 2).clue: The red kangaroo is among the largest of these pouched mammals

(4, 2).clue: (VIDEO DAILY DOUBLE):Creature seen here from the original series, it was brought back for a special "DS9" episode

(5, 2).clue: Wind instruments blown by the player are traditionally divided into woodwinds & these

(6, 2).clue: 2 rocks known as the Pillars of Hercules  flank the eastern end of this strait

(1, 3).clue: In 1698 Thomas Savery designed the first practical engine to run on this power

(2, 3).clue: This body's peacekeeping forces were awarded the Nobel Peace Prize in 1988

(3, 3).clue: One of these mammals that inhabits the East Indies has a wingspan of over 5 1/2 feet

(4, 3).clue: Zefram Cochrane, who invented this type of drive in 2061, appeared in the 1996 film "First Contact"

(5, 3).clue: In 1844 Charles Goodyear earned a patent to inhibit this material from melting & sticking

(6, 3).clue: Formerly occupied by Israel, this narrow piece of land reverted to Palestinian control in 1994

(1, 4).clue: This blood protein now comes in alpha, beta & gamma types

(2, 4).clue: After spending 188 days in space, she became the first female winner of the Space Medal of Honor

(3, 4).clue: This spiny relative of the starfish is sometimes referred to as a sea hedgehog

(4, 4).clue: The Grand Nagus is the master of commerce in this race that has 285 "Rules of Acquisition"

(5, 4).clue: Carnivorous name for the warders of the Tower of London

(6, 4).clue: The name of this Asian desert is Mongolian for "place without water"

(1, 5).clue: Simple machine Archimedes would use to "move the Earth" if you gave him a firm spot on which to stand

(2, 5).clue: The American Library Association presents an award named for this "Little House on the Prairie" author

(3, 5).clue: This largest wild cat of the Americas looks similar to a leopard

(4, 5).clue: "Benson" alumni aliens are Ethan Phillips, Neelix on "Voyager", & Rene Auberjonois, who plays this role on "DS9"

(5, 5).clue: Though blind & deaf since age 19 months, she graduated with honors from Radcliffe in 1904

(6, 5).clue: Once known as the Enchanted Isles, they lie about 600 miles west of Ecuador

(1, 1).clue: This Scotswoman was just 16 when she became queen of France in 1559

(2, 1).clue: Muslims worship the same god as Jews & Christians but usually call him by this name

(3, 1).clue: This barbeled "feline" fish is often pan-fried & served with lemon wedges

(4, 1).clue: In "Arsenic And Old Lace", the nephew who thinks he's Teddy Roosevelt digs this "canal" in the basement

(5, 1).clue: President Grant signed the legislation making this the first national park in 1872

(6, 1).clue: "Pop", as in "Pop Art", is a shortened form of this word

(1, 2).clue: In 1888 at age 19, this future spiritual leader of India arrived in England to study law

(2, 2).clue: This synagogue ceremony marking manhood dates to the Middle Ages

(3, 2).clue: Ingredients of this french fry condiment include tomatoes, cinnamon sticks, cider vinegar & garlic

(4, 2).clue: In this play by Neil Simon, Felix moves in with Oscar after his wife leaves him

(5, 2).clue: Utah's Arches National Park, which borders a deep gorge of this river, has at least 950 natural arches

(6, 2).clue: "Blackboard" & "loudspeaker" are examples of this type of word formed by combining 2 words

(1, 3).clue: This lord was a teenager when his first volume of poetry, "Fugitive Pieces", appeared in 1806

(2, 3).clue: In Catholicism it's the place of purification for the dead who still bear some trace of sin

(3, 3).clue: If you fold in beaten egg whites, these breakfast treats made in a special iron will be extra light

(4, 3).clue: This humorist wrote a "Carnival" of sketches based on his stories like "The Night The Bed Fell"

(5, 3).clue: Denali, also known as this, is the highest peak in Alaska's Denali National Park

(6, 3).clue: This suffix meaning "the study of" has become a synonym for any science

(1, 4).clue: In his teens this Elizabethan courtier from Devon fought on the Huguenot side in France's wars of religion

(2, 4).clue: Meaning "act", it's the term in Hinduism for acts done in one life that have repercussions in the next

(3, 4).clue: These rolls whose name is French for "crescent" may be brushed with beaten egg yolk before baking

(4, 4).clue: His "Ah, Wilderness!" takes place in Connecticut July 4 & 5, 1906

(5, 4).clue: Fort Jefferson in this state's Dry Tortugas National Park was a federal prison in the Civil War

(6, 4).clue: Taken together, suffixes & these are known as affixes

(1, 5).clue: Niccolo Paganini was only 13 when he began composing pieces for this instrument

(2, 5).clue: The Lun Yu or "Analects" is the most reliable source on the life & teachings of this Chinese sage

(3, 5).clue: Allergic to chocolate?  Use this health food store item, also known as locust bean, to flavor fudge

(4, 5).clue: This title heroine of a Sophocles play insists on burying her brother Polyneices

(5, 5).clue: This California park, the site of El Capitan, was administered by the U.S. Army from 1890 to 1914

(6, 5).clue: Term for words taken directly from another language; for example, "Influenza" is from Italian

(0, 0).clue: The last names of 8 different presidents end with this 3-letter combination
